superar todos los obstáculos.
·  Tendré que salvar la dificultad
del ascenso con mi silla en tres hábitats diferentes, selva, pendiente
volcánica con rocas, y en la cima nos espera la nieve. 
·  Superar aspectos vitales como
la altura a partir de los 3.000m, el frío, el calor, el esfuerzo y la
resistencia física y mental.
·  Para mí cada obstáculo es un
desafío. Las personas y la tecnología me ayudarán y de esta forma promoveré
desarrollos beneficiosos para otras personas.
·  Además, es un reto iniciático
porque será la primera vez que utilizo una silla de ruedas en un terreno tan
desconocido. Una experiencia totalmente nueva para mí que me va a alejar de mi
área de confort para conectarme con personas y experiencias nuevas.
Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar
#KilimanjaroChallenge

La idea de hacer este crowdfunding es porque quiero que todos
podáis colaborar y sentiros participes del reto. Soy consciente de que no todos
podréis ayudar con la misma cantidad, pero quiero que sepáis que para mi toda
vuestra ayuda y apoyo son igualmente valiosos. Os agradezco enormemente vuestra
aportación al reto en alguna de estas formas:
·  Por mínima que esta sea,
aportando al reto la cantidad que podáis ya que la suma de todos será la cantidad final que realmente importe.
·  Ayudándome a difundir esta campaña de crowdfunding para que llegue al mayor número de personas y que
de esta manera generemos entre todos un importante eco social.
·  Ayudándome a difundir la
plataforma en la que compartiré paso por paso todo el recorrido del reto www.diverscity.es
·  Participando y dinamizando las Redes Sociales mías personales y las
creadas para el reto
o Twitter: @Diverscity_
o Facebook: www.facebook.com/diversscity
o Instagram: http://instagram.com/diverscity_
o Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCjNjiNXJdn5HtgbwJsHUmWw
·  Conectándome con personas, empresas, medios de comunicación
o instituciones que pensáis puedan mostrar interés por este ‘Reto de
Retos’.
·  Aportando alguna colaboración
de la materia que sea. Algunas personas ya se han ofrecido a ayudarme
puntualmente, por ejemplo, con una sesión de fotos, una grabación en vídeo, un
artículo sobre el reto que han publicado en un blog o, tanto yo como el equipo,
podemos probar cualquier producto o servicio que puedan ser útiles en el reto. . Muchas personas os habéis ofrecido como voluntarias para ayudarme en las distintas tareas que conlleva el reto.
Os
agradezco a todos vuestra valiosa contribución para lograr este reto
maravilloso. Lo importante es que todos juntos alcanzaremos la cima.
Me tenéis siempre cerca en las redes
sociales @GemaHassenBey, @diverscity_, Facebook, Youtube... y en www.diverscity.es
GRACIAS :D
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
ENGLISH
‘Cumbre Bey’ - Kilimanjaro Challenge – 2st Mountain Peak
‘Cumbre Bey’ the Challenge of the Challenges
#KilimanjaroChallenge

Welcome
to ‘Cumbre Bey’ - Kilimanjaro Challenge!
I would like to introduce myself to
those of you who do not know me. My name is Gema Hassen-Bey, Paralympic
medallist in fencing and social communicator. I have participated in five consecutive Paralympic Games
(Barcelona 92, Atlanta 96, Sydney 2000, Athens 2004 and Beijing 2008) and I
have also worked as an expert in social communication. I collaborated with
innovative projects like the social program “El mundo se mueve contigo” for the
Spanish National TV network, TVE, and in the first recap program about the
Paralympic Games in Spain, “Resumen Especial Paralímpicos Londres 2012”,
broadcast on Teledeporte channel. I
consider myself to be a person interested in big challenges that help me to
improve my life and the life of others.
I would like to invite you to take part
in my new project. A special trip linked with a personal sports, historical and social challenge, ‘Cumbre Bey –
Kilimanjaro Challenge’ http://diverscity.es/el-reto-cumbre-bey/
I hope to become a milestone, to become
the first women in a wheelchair to climb
Mount Kilimanjaro, almost at 6,000 meters (5,895m), with my own strength
and abilities.
Although the first objective is reach
the top, the most important goal for me
is the process to get there. The road that I follow to reach the top of the
mountain, and the way that I can help other people to improve their lives. For
that reason I will share everything
through the portal www.diverscity.es
Twitter, Instagram and Facebook.
I will not go alone, I have an expert
team to help me manage everything, “La Cordada”. 
Although 15 people will be involved in
the “Kilimanjaro challenge”, anybody can join us to be the best climbing team
ever! I hope we will have 15 million
people conquering the Mount Kilimanjaro. I will ascend with the help of
each of you. Connected by the values that move us, together we will show that
everyone can reach their own peak.
My
philosophy of life is, ‘if you move, the world moves with you’
Our necessities
#KilimanjaroChallenge

·  To conquer the peak of the
Mount Kilimanjaro I must plan my training very well this year. For health
reasons, before the Kilimanjaro challenge, I
must climb other mountains, around 7
summits that I will tell you about later. To share with all of you, each
summit will have a specific crowdfunding; I hope that everyone who collaborates
with the Project will be happy to be involved with this kind of challenge.
·  My first peak and my first ‘Challenge
of the Challenges’ it was Mount
Abantos at 1,753 metres. Located
in the Sierra de Guadarrama in the town of San Lorenzo de El Escorial, in the
Community of Madrid. The coordinates are: 40°37′N
4°09′WThe successful conclusion and the media echo of this milestone were made. You can see it on this link:http://diverscity.es/destacado/as-tv-abantos/· THE SECOND SUMMIT is the BOLA DEL MUNDO 2.265m Alto de las Guarramillas in Navacerrada Madrid - Coordinates 40°47′06″N 3°58′44″O
·  To climb this summit I need to get some changes to the Explorer Handbike All Terrain  manufactured en Poland, a way of transporting the team to the baseline of the mountain, the correct nutrition to ascend the
peak and the trekking kit for the
team and for me. In addition to the costs of logistics and communications.
·  Even though I live surrounded
by mountains, I never have climbed one of them in a wheelchair. I want to provoke the production of a
wheelchair like this, in order that people like me can enjoy and discover
the nature.
·  Absolutely every cent of money that we collect will be earmarked for
this project and I will relate everything that happens and how we invest
your money. Don’t forget that you can follow the challenge through www.diverscity.es  
·  If we achieve the funding we
will organise a special event with
all of you to celebrate this successful first stage. A special time to
celebrate with everybody who helped me to reach this challenge. 
·  Thank you very much for participating in this ‘Challenge of the
Challenges’.
‘Cumbre Bey’ media impact
#KilimanjaroChallenge

A lot of important, well known media
are publishing the ‘Kilimanjaro challenge’. The dailies: Marca, El País, La
Razón, La Vanguardía and 20 Minutos; the radios: SER, Cope, RNE, Radio Libertad
and OndaCero and a lot of websites and blogs are supporting the challenge. You
can see the news and interviews in Diversity’ pressroom www.diverscity.es .This is just the
beginning, more to come!
·  It will be an effective
challenge and I will share everything about coaching, technical training,
technical development and R&D&I to try to help other people to improve
their quality of life by my responsible and proactive position. 
·  Previously I did other
challenges and I guarantee you that if I plan something I achieve the objective
Challenges that I have achieved are:
o  I became the pioneer in
Paralympic fencing in Spain.
o  I was the first Spanish athlete
to win a Paralympic medal (Barcelona 92).
o  I have participated in five
consecutive Paralympic games.
o  I was the first Paralympic
athlete to take an active part in an Olympic candidacy (Madrid 2M12).
o  I created and presented the
first TV program with social contents.
o  I inspired, created and
presented the first Paralympic Games broadcast by Teledeporte TV for London
2012.
·  Now I am presenting you with
this ‘Challenge of the Challenges’. You have my commitment because henceforth
my life will be focused on ‘Cumbre Bey –
Kilimanjaro Challenge"Challenges that have been achieved in the #KilimanjaroChallengeo All Terrain Hanbyke Explorer and already ther are companies working on their improvement to enable mountan climb for people with disabilities.o Presentation of the challenge at kilometer 0 of Puerta del Sol in Madrid with the support of president of Community of Madrid.o Ascend my firt summit Mount Abantos 1.753m in San Lorenzo del Escorial Madrid, acoompanied by officials of the Community of Madrid.o Attend Social entrepreneur woman or as selected by the USAEMBASSY in Spain to GES2015 Nairobi supported by the President Obama.o Browse for the first time a pilgrimage route to Camino de Santiago en Galicia accessible along with 200 dsabled people and the galician association COGAMI.o Perform various conferences or motivation for employees of interntional companies and universitys.
The dangers and the challenges
#KilimanjaroChallenge

I am aware that the ‘Challenge of the
Challenges’ is an amazing adventure in where I am not fighting for a medal, I
am risking my life for a dream. But all dangers are acceptable if you work with
time and care. For that reason, the best team ever is going with me and each
one of them is helping me to overcome every obstacle. 
·  On Mount Kilimanjaro my
wheelchair and I will have to cross three different habitats: jungle, volcanic
slopes with rocks and snow at the top.
·  At 3,000 meters I must overcome
the altitude, the cold, the heat, the sacrifice and the physical and mental
challenges.
·  Each obstacle will be an
adversary. People and technology will help me and I will promote beneficial
business developments to help others.
·  It is an initiation challenge
because it will be the first time that I will use a wheelchair in these kinds
of areas. A new experience that will move me away from my comfort zone to
connect me with new people and amazing experiences.
Other ways to collaborate
#KilimanjaroChallenge

The beginning to make this crowdfunding
is because I would involve all of you in the project to be part in the
challenge. I am aware that not everyone will be able to help with the same
amount, but I want you to know that for me all your help and support are
equally valuable. I will be grateful if you can collaborate with one of the
next ways:
·  You can contribute with the
challenge the amount that you can. The
total raised is what really matters. 
·  You can help me to promote this crowdfunding campaign to
reach as many people to obtain an important social effect.
·  You can help me to promote www.diverscity.es The portal where I will
share everything
·  Following and forwarding all
the social media networks. Through
my personal Twitter and Facebook and also with Diverscity networks:
o Twitter: @Diverscity_
o Facebook: www.facebook.com/diversscity
o Instagram: http://instagram.com/diverscity_
o Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCjNjiNXJdn5HtgbwJsHUmWw
·  To connect me with People, Companies, Media or Institutions
that you think they may be interested in the 'Challenge of the Challenges'.
·  Providing me some kind of
collaboration. Some people have already offered to help me with a photo shoot,
a video recording, an article about the challenge published in their blog or
you can send to me, or to the team, useful products or services to the
challenge that we can test.
Thank
you so much for each effort to reach this amazing challenge.
Whenever you want, you can contact with
me through the social networks: @GemaHassenBey, @diverscity_, Facebook,
Youtube... or via www.diverscity.es
THANKS!

story:
Sandwich Girl Has Got Her Truck!

I think every entrepreneur has gone through that moment where their need to accomplish a goal becomes their only priority. After 10+ years experience in the service and hospitality industry, I've found that making people happy while satisfying their appetite is something that I love to do. Seven years ago, I wanted to start Sandwich Girl in the kitchen of my studio apartment, only delivering to a 2 mile radius. Since then I have had doors shut in my face and heard the word "NO" more times than I'd like to admit. My persistence and confidence in Sandwich Girl allowed me to never give up, and as of two weeks ago the reputable Chef Max Hardy has given me his truck! I have exactly 1 month to pick it up from Miami and get  her up and running. I came here to ask my family, friends and Sandwich Girl believers to help me and my team get down to Miami to launch Sandwich Girl once and for all. 

 Here is where your much needed funding is going:

  1. Flight to Miami for myself and our executive chef
  2. A place to stay during Sandwich Girls off hours
  3. First round of supplies and inventory from local purveyors in Miami.
  4. Truck wrap addition. We need to get our beautiful logo on our truck!
  5. Cost of tolls, gas and permits to park in each city. We will be traveling from Miami to New York spreading good food and positive energy. 


Sandwich Girl Saves the World

We live in a world where chain restaurants, quick unhealthy eateries, and sub par restaurants flourish our neighborhoods. Sandwich Girl aims to give the "wow factor" on both sides of fence by providing a joyful, fun experience of a living comic book themed food truck; added with each superhero having her own delectable gourmet sandwich. Sandwich Girl aims to become one with each city, event, concert and location by catering to season harvests and local farmers.  Fresh ingredients and delightful sandwich recipes are only the tip of the iceberg!!! Work ethic is a reflection of moral ethic, with that in mind, Sandwich Girl aims to be a part of the community by contributing to schools and educating children on proper eating habits.  Sandwich Girl will support healthy body image for young girls and more importantly be honest with our ingredients. 

Our team is led by Chef Jose Gonzalez  of 67 Orange Street as our executive chef. After presenting the Sandwich Girl vision to him, Chef Jose automatically got on board. We have been working side by side to perfect the art of sandwich making. We are not reinventing the wheel, but perfecting it. Our sandwiches are innovative, original and simply delicious. We have combined tastes from Latin American, Mediterranean, Asian and Southern cuisines. 

 Chef Jose has also been volunteering with City Harvest since 2008, and plans to contribute his knowledge and efforts in fighting hunger in inner cities with the Sandwich Girl team. 

Sandwich Girl vs. Hunger

Sandwich Girl and Chef Max Hardy have teamed up to continue his initiative to end hunger in inner cities. 16.2 million children will suffer from hunger at some time during the year and nearly 22% of children under the age of 18 live in poverty. Sandwich Girl has promised to dedicate her time and resources in bringing awareness and add a helping hand to end the horrible epidemic that is hunger.


Be a Part of The Heroic Movement

Your donations do not end here. All of Sandwich Girls supporters will have a permanent place in our movement. Food and culture have alway combined to bring change, enlighten people and give the food truck world a sense of pride. Sandwich Girl wants to give back. All of our supporters will have a say in a charity of their choice that they would like Sandwich Girl to support.

story:
Twenty five years ago, only a handful of people practiced or sought out holistic practitioners. Today natural healing has become so commonplace, treatment options are abundant and can be confusing. There are as many modalities as there are letters of the alphabet--from Aromatherapy to Z-Acu therapy--and it’s tough to discern what is what.

Natural Healing Demystified is a community anthology in which 25 talented holistic practitioners throughout Rhode Island and Connecticut break it down for you; letting you know who they are, what they do and how they can help you.  For example, you might flip through the pages of this book to make an informed choice between acupuncture or massage therapy to treat your lower back pain. If you have a psychic snag in your heart you might check whether a sound healer or shaman is the right person to soothe you.  If you have a more serious disease such as cancer or diabetes and want to include natural healing in diagnoses or treatment turn to this book to learn about thermography, herbology and more.

Whether you are a long term natural healing enthusiast or a closeted natural healing newbie, this book is for you.

This book will help you gain a foothold in these resurrected medical arts. Help your community and get yourself an awesome book.

Contributing Authors

Anne Belliveau (Sound Healing)

Kimberly Tesla (Energy Healing)

Roberta Lewis (EFT and Hypnotherapy)

Anne McPhail (Health Coach)

Dan McDonnell (CranioSacral Therapy)

Farrah Kaeser (Herbology & Reiki)

Richard Pass (Shamanism)

Kim Abraham (Yoga)

Tina Shifflett (IET)

Dr. Jamie Lee (Thermography)

And more...

Why should you support this campaign? The Caveat. Beggars Bowl.  Anyone who knows a natural healer, knows their businesses are often a labor of love and rarely a way to drum up boo coo money. Healers do their work because they love it, and they believe in helping people heal and to shift to healthier lifestyles and perspectives.  Support them as they have supported you.

If you know and respect any of the aforementioned healers, make a donation and get your book.

If you have ever been perplexed about a specific modality or hemmed and hawed over which service to pick, make a donation and get your book.

If you believe in natural healing, make a donation and get a book.

Please note, if you do decide to donate please plug in whole numbers only, no $.

Where will your money go?

The money raised in this campaign will go towards the editing, photography, graphic design/cover design, layout and printing of initial copies of Natural Healing Demystified.

All practitioners who contributed to this book will receive a percentage of the books proceeds.

Other ways you can help: Tag, you are it. Please, please, please share a link to this campaign with your Facebook, Twitter and Linked In friends and with your real life friends, family, colleagues, clients, waiters, dishwashers, dry cleaners and dog park buds.

story:
Short Summary

There are roughly 673 Million people in Mexico, Central and South America, most of them without access to adequate healthcare. It is our mission to bring natural healthcare to this part of the world, to those who need it most!  We have successfully trained Natural Health Sciences Practitioners who currently are operating an NHS Clinic in Mexico.  The need is so great that some patients drive over six hours to be treated at this facility. The conditions helped by these practitioners include: disc injuries, digestive problems, asthma, colic, skin conditions, arthritis, neuropathy, neck and back problems, migraines, headaches, vertigo, nutritional deficiencies and a host of other debilitating health problems.

After opening this clinic and seeing both the dramatic impact on the health of the patients and the overwhelming demand for the care, it has become evident there is a need to train and support additional practitioners throughout Mexico, Central America and South America who can return to their communities and establish additional Natural Health Science Clinics.  As a result, the Natural Health Science Institute (Instituto de Ciencias Naturales de la Salud) was established in 2014.  Through the efforts and personal financial contributions of the founders as well as through the support of the local community, a school location and class room facilities have been established.  On August 17th 2015 the first class of the Natural Health Sciences Institute began their studies!


This is where YOU come in! We have done all we can with the resources we have. Students are in need of sponsorship! 

Even though a Student's tuition is only 10% the cost of an equivalent education in the United States, there are many who have the desire to serve, the ability to learn and the dream to succeed, but do not have the financial means to pay for the tuition.

What We Need & What You Get

Our campaign goal is $50,000. Here's what we need it for:

  • Student Tuition: $35,000. This amount should cover our projected first year of students.  We currently have 4 enrolled students. Three of them are in need of tuition assistance.  There are three more students ready to begin the program but all three need tuition assistance as well. These students do not come from wealthy families. They do however have a burning desire to help the communities they live in. They need funds to cover their tuition and living expenses.
  • Taxes on these donations: $10,000
  • Indiegogo's fee: $2500
  • Third Party fees (PayPal, CC, etc): $1500-$2500
Here's what happens if we exceed or do not meet our goal:
  • If we do not meet our goal: We will use the money we have acquired to provide sponsorships for as many students as we can help, based on the dollars collected. 
  • If we EXCEED our goal: We will use the funding to improve our facilities. We have a need for more classroom and clinical equipment as well as teaching supplies. We also owe money to suppliers for computer equipment installed in the classroom and for upgraded internet service installed at the school to aid with internet based learning.
Here is what YOU get:

Any donation is appreciated.  An individual donation of $4000 will allow sponsorship of one student through the entire NHS certification program. You will be provided the name and picture of your student and you will be kept updated on their progress as they complete the certification process.  No matter the size of your donation, you will know that your money is being used to lift students in an underprivileged part of the world out of a bleak future into a position of hope for their future and a position to improve the health care in this underserved part of the world.

The Impact

This is just the beginning. This is the first school, the first students. The NHS vision is to change healthcare for the world by providing proven, effective, and natural healing. Thomas Edison explains NHS's future best: 

“The doctor of the future will give no medication, but will interest his patients in the care of the human frame, diet and in the cause and prevention of disease. ~ ”

Our clinic in Mexico has the practitioners of the future that Edison was talking about. These clinicians have been operating for nearly 10 years and literally have touched thousands of lives, restoring health and maintaining the health of people who otherwise would never have had access to natural and effective care. 


These are some of the students that your donation will be helping. Each of the students will touch tens of thousands of lives throughout their career. 

Risks & Challenges

Many challenges have already been conquered. Here is a list of what we have done so far:

-A comprehensive curriculum including basic health sciences as well as clinical sciences has been established.

-A clinical setting has been found to provide practical clinical training for the students.

-A school building and classroom facilities have been located and access procured to allow us a clean and effective environment to teach.

-Computer access with updated internet have been installed in the classroom to aid with internet based learning.

-Qualified faculty willing to work for now at no compensation to support this vision have been identified and are now instructing in the Institute.

-Students who have the innate desire to bring healing into their communities have come forward and more are coming to us interested in beginning this journey

The ball is rolling, the question is how fast can you help us push it? The people of Mexico, Central America and South America are in need right now.  Our current students are from Mexico, however, we have individuals from as far away as Guyana, South America who have heard of our program and would like to enroll.  Finances are a concern for them.  You can help their dream become a reality.

Our future challenges are:

-Accommodating an increasing number of students with the facilities we have

-Establishing appropriate compensation for our instructors

-Establishing a financial foundation for the Natural Sciences Institute that is stable and enduring so future generations of practitioners will have the same opportunity our students have today

-Spreading the message of Natural Health Sciences throughout Mexico, Central America and South America.

-Establishing high quality NHS Clinics operated by our graduates throughout this part of the world

If you love helping people live better lives but can't afford to donate, here's what you can do:

Share Share Share!! Share this on any of your social media platforms. Tell your friends, tell your family, get excited! The future of worldwide natural health care is here!

PS: Stand tall behind your promotion of our campaign. This is the future of health care. It is already happening in Mexico. We have seen proven results time and time again. The NHS system works.

need it most!  We have successfully
trained Natural Health Sciences Practitioners who currently are operating an
NHS Clinic in Mexico.  The need is so
great that some patients drive over six hours to be treated at this facility. The
conditions helped by these practitioners include: disc injuries, digestive problems, asthma, colic, skin
conditions, arthritis, neuropathy, neck and back problems, migraines, headaches, vertigo, nutritional deficiencies and a host
of other debilitating health problems.
After opening this clinic and seeing both the dramatic impact on
the health of the patients and the overwhelming demand for the care, it has
become evident there is a need to train and support additional practitioners throughout Mexico, Central America and South America who can return to
their communities and establish additional Natural Health Science Clinics.  As a result, the Natural Health
Science Institute (Instituto de Ciencias Naturales de la Salud) was established
in 2014.  Through the efforts and
personal financial contributions of the founders as well as through the support
of the local community, a school location and class room facilities have been
established.  On August 17th
2015 the first class of the Natural Health Sciences Institute began their
studies!






This is where YOU come in! We have done all we can with the resources we have. Students are in need of sponsorship! 

Even though a Student's tuition is only 10% the cost of an
equivalent education in the United States, there are many who have the desire to
serve, the ability to learn and the dream to succeed, but do not have the
financial means to pay for the tuition.
   What We Need & What You Get
Our campaign goal is $50,000. Here's what we need it for:




Student Tuition: $35,000. This amount should cover our projected
first year of students.  We currently have 4 enrolled students. Three of
them are in need of tuition assistance. 
There are three more students ready to begin the program but all three need
tuition assistance as well. These students do not come
from wealthy families. They do however have a burning desire to help the
communities they live in. They need funds to cover their tuition and living
expenses.


Taxes on these donations: $10,000


Indiegogo's fee: $2500

Third Party fees (PayPal, CC, etc): $1500-$2500
Here's what happens if we exceed or do not meet our goal:



If we do not meet our goal: 
We will use the money we have acquired to provide sponsorships for as
many students as we can help, based on the dollars collected. 


If we EXCEED our goal: 
We will use the funding to improve our facilities. We have a need for
more classroom and clinical equipment as well as teaching supplies. We also owe
money to suppliers for computer equipment installed in the classroom and for
upgraded internet service installed at the school to aid with internet based
learning.


Here is what YOU get:


Any donation is appreciated. 
An individual donation of $4000 will allow sponsorship of one student
through the entire NHS certification program. You will be provided the name and
picture of your student and you will be kept updated on their progress as they
complete the certification process.  No
matter the size of your donation, you will know that your money is being used
to lift students in an underprivileged part of the world out of a bleak future
into a position of hope for their future and a position to improve the health
care in this underserved part of the world.

    The Impact 

This is just
the beginning. This is the first school, the first students. The NHS vision is
to change healthcare for the world by providing proven, effective, and natural
healing. Thomas Edison explains NHS's future best: 

“The doctor of the future will give no medication, but will interest his patients in the care of the human frame, diet and in the cause and prevention of disease. ~ ”

Our clinic in Mexico has the practitioners of the future that
Edison was talking about. These clinicians have been operating for nearly 10
years and literally have touched thousands of lives, restoring health and
maintaining the health of people who otherwise would never have had access to
natural and effective care. 






These are some of the students that your donation will be helping. Each of the students will touch tens of thousands of lives throughout their career. 



Risks & Challenges

Many challenges have already been conquered. Here is a list of
what we have done so far:
-A comprehensive curriculum including basic health sciences as
well as clinical sciences has been established.
-A clinical setting has been found to provide practical clinical
training for the students.
-A school building and classroom facilities have been located
and access procured to allow us a clean and effective environment to teach.
-Computer access with updated internet have been installed in
the classroom to aid with internet based learning.
-Qualified faculty willing to work for now at no compensation to
support this vision have been identified and are now instructing in the
Institute.
-Students who have the innate desire to bring healing into their
communities have come forward and more are coming to us interested in beginning
this journey
The ball is rolling, the question is how fast can you help us
push it? The people of Mexico, Central America and South America are in need
right now.  Our current students are from
Mexico, however, we have individuals from as far away as Guyana, South America
who have heard of our program and would like to enroll.  Finances are a concern for them.  You can help their dream become a reality.
Our future challenges are:
-Accommodating an increasing number of students with the
facilities we have
-Establishing appropriate compensation for our instructors
-Establishing a financial foundation for the Natural Sciences
Institute that is stable and enduring so future generations of practitioners
will have the same opportunity our students have today
-Spreading the message of Natural Health Sciences throughout
Mexico, Central America and South America.
-Establishing high quality NHS Clinics operated by our graduates
throughout this part of the world

    If you love helping people live better lives but can't afford to donate, here's what you can do: 
Share Share
Share!! Share this on any of your social media platforms. Tell your friends,
tell your family, get excited! The future of worldwide natural health care is
here!
PS: Stand tall
behind your promotion of our campaign. This is the future of health care. It is
already happening in Mexico. We have seen proven results time and time again. The
NHS system works.

BioTech does the same thing with Energy Waves to specific frequencies in the body to remove bugs or illness. And we don't like needles or blood as we are geeks.


We have just taken 8 months to simplify this Science so is easy to use with high results- as of today 26 March we have online software to download and be using in 2 minutes using 1 to 10 frequencies at 1 time. We supply the full list of healing codes- Please see list at bottom of page - to cover 97% forms of illness and be using this on your headphones or stereo speakers. Just released and on Indiegogo for $99 introduction offer- normal price for this kind of software is $299 to $799. 

The best part is using just a few nights a week can boost the human system as these waves affect every area of the Mind Body and Spirit, we are after all just Spiritual Be-ings in a physical world where there is daily conflict and stress...Even Google is moving in this direction of natural Evolution with a watch 5 years away

Google has filed a patent application with the World Intellectual Property Organization (WIPO) for a wrist-worn device that could destroy cancer cells in the blood.

Quantum Synergy works on ANY area related to Health Mind Body and Spirit so can be used by any persons dealing with illness, patients, Nurses or Doctors and Homeopaths - thousands are Globally.

This is Universal Energy using Vibration, codes and frequencies simply to Charge Spirit Mind and Body. As Tesla and Einstein simply say-"use frequencies and Vibration to get Energy." we provide access by specific Scientific website to Free Energy and we give you the list of codes and frequencies needed.



We've added a Microprocessor and Memory and latest "Life Chip"  Technology to bring you a first class compact easy to use transmitter, simply attach it with 2 pads and turn on and set it to your level and comfort of use. (these will arrive mid year)


We can use Sound, Energy waves or Light to transmit this human energy but find energy Waves via pads on the Portable as below is the simple way and most effective, so we can just sleep with the boosting for 8 hours using the pads either on feet hands or in the area of the body to be re-vitalized. 

    PLUS           

  Equals 

Energy-Balance-Inner Harmony-Peace-Love.


Available in Black or White units, you can order and expect delivery within 4 weeks.


This Science can be used by anyone but especially those who need a Natural boost with No side effects. Don't wait until you collapse, use Synergy to stay at 100% levels.       
  

If we compare this with well known Tens machines that are used in Hospitals and Clinics globally for the past 15 years we see that Synergy is a comparable field but more advanced and far more versatile/Universal in use.

Just out of interest a Dog has an average Vibration of 500 yet a man is still between 200 and 300 levels so Mankind has a ways to go -this is what our Science brings, Energy using frequency codes to Raise our Wellness and Vibration and used simply.
Everything in life revolves on this, our Vibration Aura and Spiritual connection...
A dog is at Pure Love, it does not know greed or anger, ego, money or conflict.
This form of Energy has been used over 50 years by the Russians, when they have an Athlete hurt on the track, this equipment stops the bleeding and allows the athlete to keep going using pain relief settings.
Meditation is the key to your Spiritual reality and open your 7 chraka's -use either our Soundtracks or direct energy to express tap into 100% wellness. It took me 46 years to learn meditation the hard way, there is always an easy intelligent way if we are ready to Evolve.

1 -A Portable unit now discounted at $199 retail at end March $299 for Universal energy applications that apply to you.
What We Need & What You Get
  • We need to spread the word that Energy is key to health and life.
  • We are holding the portable at $199 introduction but Retail will be $299 as of end March so grab one now- our desktop unit ready now is at $299 the unit coming with Wifi and high Tech components will be at $699 mid year.
  • We need to reach $40000 to start production on the Wifi units that will be most popular and tie in with Smartphones and wider applications.

    UK 044 7709270255  7 days 8 am to 8 pm
  • dave@biotechsyn.com    we are easy to talk with or answer questions

Questions and Answers

Why does one need this Synergy?

This is Quantum Energy or Universal application used simply to repair ANY area of a human, especially Mind Spirit and Body and we have a Global network to support any new user-we don't just ship you a Transmitter-it is the Science that flows through it that you need and we provide all codes and frequencies with the order, or contact us anytime by email or phone 12/7. Simple to use as a Toothbrush.

Is this safe and easy to use?

Yes, proven since 1934 and used Globally by over 300000 people and growing fast as we adapt now to the Technology and opening of minds. Yes simple to use, simply select and enter the codes to affect your energy and life. You can use it for an hour or sleep with the pads attached to your feet or ankles with light socks to hold them in place, this will give a great 8 hour session of rejuvenation. 8 to 16 hours a week will be fine for most people to live at 100%.

Can I feel the energy?
Yes, you can either feel a light beat similar to a heartbeat or a steady flow of energy waves, similar to a very small electrical current in milliamps with HUGE quantum results rapidly, expect results as it has done for 77 years.

How long does it take to have effect?
It depends what you are using it for, for pain or headaches to back problems, the effect is quick, we have seen results in minutes, but don't be impatient just apply the energy and wait for results. Quantum energy can't be pushed or rushed.

What similar machines are used and how do they differ?
Tens machines have been widely used in hospitals and clinics for the past 15 years
but the power and application is Universal for Synergy, Tens machines are good for pain or muscle or therapy -use Synergy for Energy Universal and Pets.

So these use Energy Waves and I program in the frequencies?
Yes, we supply all codes and frequencies with the equipment, customers can call in for questions 12/7 12 hours a day 7 days a week 8am to 8pm London UK time. You use the codes and applications that fit you.
At first it will feel strange but as you start to Energize and get results and see where this can take you, its an easy Quantum step to a new lifestyle.

What is the difference between the Portable and Desktop units.
The portable is simple to use and carry anywhere like a smartphone, the desktop connects to the internet for use age and has wider range for more serious type applications. The portable is best low cost choice at $199 and ready to go.

When will Wifi units be arriving?
We anticipate late May this year at this point. Funding controls delivery.



We have a team of Global minds working on this in USA India China Mexico UK and Europe and open to more minds coming in, nothing is achieved by 1 man it is always a Team spirit.

Diane Strong   Sales and Service
John Hu            Manufacture China
Steve B            Manufacture India

A team of 7 Soft and Hardware Engineers

1934 Dr Royal pioneers this Science for a major breakthrough
Many dozens of Doctors and Scientists continue the work adapting and improving for the next 70 years...

2015 - develop a simple transmitter able to apply 80000 codes and frequency
but focus on just top 20
end February we start shipping the Portable or Desktop units
May we expect to have Wifi unit funded for release
June we release the Biofeedback and Bio-Resonance to Hospitals and Clinics- this will be advanced Body Scanner with Energy and Powerful Light combination, can be used at Homes.
At this stage we expect about 2 Million have explored or entered the Quantum pathway yet this is only a small number when looking at a Global population of 7.3 Billion, it takes time for good news to travel and become part of Evolution...

story:
How do you feel about the phenomenon of sexual abuse in our community?

Reactions vary; some people retreat into denial, while others are filled with rage, but almost all of us feel frustrated and powerless to do something that will really make a difference.

Tackling the problem of sexual abuse seems like a daunting task, because there are several factors involved. Think about family therapy: a group of people come in and point their fingers at the one person who seems to be causing all the trouble. That person is called the “identified patient." A skilled practitioner, however, knows that it's not that simple; the “troublemaker” is part of a whole family system, whose members are also colluding—even without knowing it—to sustain his problem behavior. That's how it is with sexual abuse. In any sex abuse scenario you have:

  • The perpetrator

  • The victim

  • The community/culture/society in which it happens

  • Mental health resources

  • The legal/correctional system

In order to know how to intervene, you have to take all of these players and factors into consideration. Thinking from the bottom of the list upwards, we know that:

  • the legal system has a procedure to investigate, arrest, try, indict and sentence an abuser

  • there is standardized treatment for offenders, but it is almost never utilized outside of court-mandated cases

  • communities need to develop and consistently update their plans for safety and accountability

  • thankfully, there are many resources to help people who have become victims of abuse, and their continuous development and accessibility is crucial

Many of us, if we aren't flummoxed by concepts like loshon hora (slander), mesirah (illegitimate betrayal to authorities), and by concerns about tarnishing the reputation of the abuser's family, throw our hands up in the face of others' denial and apathy.

We need targeted, concrete action.

There's one area of intervention that has not been pursued, not as a community: the treatment of perpetrators and would-be perpetrators.

Problematic behaviors stem from a variety of causes, from pedophilia to abuse history, psychopathy, maladaptive coping under stress, depression, and misplaced teenage curiosity. Boundary problems, power imbalances, pornography and sexual addictions—all of these are factors that can be addressed in treatment. Unfortunately most of the time, these are never dealt with and the perpetrator either continues to behave as he does, or ends up in jail for a limited period of time—and then is back in the community. What about the vast majority of people who never end up in jail, desperately want help for their problems, and would self-refer if an option for discreet, affordable, targeted therapy existed?

Enter the Jerusalem Institute for Behavioral Health (JIBH). A unique behavioral medicine clinic, the JIBH brings together the core competencies of clinical psychology, sex offender treatment, and psychiatry to provide thorough, intensive and professional help for people struggling with problematic thinking and behaviors. Unlike other treatment centers, the JIBH brings the values-orientation of Logotherapy to unify these elements around what may be the most important therapeutic target: the obvious gap between the client's values and his behaviors. The right treatment approach can enable abusive people to uncover their own humanity, their empathy, and their ability to live according to the values they do have, according to the most basic human decency.

Recognizing the uniqueness of every individual, the JIBH offers subsidized case management tailored to the needs of each client.  The JIBH offers:

  • Full risk assessment and psychological screening

  • Cognitive and behavioral strategies to identify triggers, distorted thinking patterns, deviant fantasizing, and unhealthy coping mechanisms

  • Assumption of responsibility for past actions

  • Empathy training

  • Psychotherapy

  • Values exploration and strengthening

  • Relapse prevention

  • Psychiatric evaluation and medication, where needed

  • Substance abuse treatment, where needed

Currently based in Jerusalem, with the aim of expansion, the JIBH provides a discreet and meaningful location for undergoing treatment culturally geared for English-speakers from Western countries.

The JIBH also offers consultancy to communities worldwide, providing professional advisement and case management around these phenomena wherever they are taking place, and aiding communal leadership in their efforts to establish standards of safety, transparency and integrity in their own communities.  Examples of consulting services we offer include:

  • Problem-solving through specific cases within the community

  • Conflict management and mediation

  • Abuser/victim clarification and reconciliation, including victim safety planning

  • Safety assessment and planning for communal institutions, including schools, religious facilities, camps, and places of employment

  • Formulation of policy, procedure and protocol for use in communal settings

Support the launch of the JIBH: mental health clinic, community education and outreach source, think-tank, and consultancy firm, able to deliver strategic solutions in therapy, in community education and in workplace safety.


Our Clinical Director

Tani Burton is the Clinical Director of the JIBH. A licensed social worker in Israel, He holds a masters degree in social work from Yeshiva University's Wuzweiler School of Social Work, as well as a Clinical Diplomate in Logotherapy from the Viktor Frankl Institue. Tani has worked in agency, educational, and private practice settings, and gained a sub-specialty in sexual offender treatment as a co-facilitator of forensic therapy groups and as a psychotherapist. Tani is responsible for the concept of the JIBH as well as the maintenance of its vision, human resources and staff hiring, community and professional outreach, and most importantly providing clinical services.


Our Campaign Goal

Our goal is to open the doors of the JIBH by the end of March 2015. The initial $50,000 will enable us to retain the legal services needed to obtain non-profit status in the United States and Israel, create and distribute promotional materials, launch a marketing and social media campaign, obtain necessary licenses, hire part-time therapeutic team members as needed and to procure and furnish an appropriate office space in a discreet location.
story_txt:
How do you feel about the phenomenon of
sexual abuse in our community? 



Reactions vary; some people retreat
into denial, while others are filled with rage, but almost all of us
feel frustrated and powerless to do something that will really
make a difference.


Tackling the problem of sexual abuse
seems like a daunting task, because there are several factors
involved.  Think about family therapy: a group of people come in and
point their fingers at the one person who seems to be causing all the
trouble.  That person is called the “identified patient."  A
skilled practitioner, however, knows that it's not that simple; the
“troublemaker” is part of a whole family system, whose members
are also colluding—even without knowing it—to sustain his problem
behavior.  That's how it is with sexual abuse.  In any sex abuse
scenario you have:




The perpetrator


The victim


The community/culture/society in
	which it happens


Mental health resources


The legal/correctional system




In order to know how to intervene, you
have to take all of these players and factors into consideration. 
Thinking from the bottom of the list upwards, we know that: 





the legal system has a procedure
	to investigate, arrest, try, indict and sentence an abuser 
	


there is standardized treatment
	for offenders, but it is almost never utilized outside of court-mandated cases


communities need to develop and consistently update their plans for safety and accountability

thankfully, there are many resources to help people who have become 
victims of abuse, and their continuous development and accessibility is 
crucial 




Many of us, if we aren't flummoxed by
concepts like loshon hora (slander),
mesirah (illegitimate betrayal to authorities), and by
concerns about tarnishing the reputation of the abuser's family,
throw our hands up in the face of others' denial and apathy.  



We need targeted, concrete
action.


There's
one area of intervention that has not been pursued, not as a
community: the treatment of perpetrators and
would-be perpetrators. 



Problematic behaviors stem from a
variety of causes, from pedophilia to abuse history, psychopathy,
maladaptive coping under stress, depression, and misplaced teenage
curiosity.  Boundary problems, power imbalances, pornography and
sexual addictions—all of these are factors that can be addressed in
treatment.  Unfortunately most of the time, these are never dealt
with and the perpetrator either continues to behave as he does, or
ends up in jail for a limited period of time—and then is back in
the community. What about the vast majority of people who
never end up in jail, desperately want help for their problems, and
would self-refer if an option for discreet, affordable, targeted
therapy existed?


Enter the Jerusalem Institute for
Behavioral Health (JIBH).  A unique behavioral medicine clinic,
the JIBH brings together the core competencies of clinical
psychology, sex offender treatment, and psychiatry to provide
thorough, intensive and professional help for people struggling with
problematic thinking and behaviors.  Unlike other treatment centers,
the JIBH brings the values-orientation of Logotherapy to unify these
elements around what may be the most important therapeutic target:
the obvious gap between the client's values and his behaviors. 
The
right treatment approach can enable abusive people to uncover their
own humanity, their empathy, and their ability to live according to
the values they do have, according to the most basic human decency.


Recognizing the uniqueness of every
individual, the JIBH offers subsidized case management tailored
to the needs of each client.  The JIBH offers:


Full risk assessment and
	psychological screening 
	


Cognitive and behavioral
	strategies to identify triggers, distorted thinking patterns,
	deviant fantasizing, and unhealthy coping mechanisms 
	


Assumption of responsibility for
	past actions 
	


Empathy training 
	


Psychotherapy 
	


Values exploration and
	strengthening 
	


Relapse prevention 
	


Psychiatric evaluation and
	medication, where needed 
	


Substance abuse treatment, where needed 
	


Currently
based in Jerusalem, with the aim of expansion, the JIBH provides a
discreet and meaningful location for undergoing treatment culturally
geared for English-speakers from Western countries.
The JIBH also offers consultancy to communities worldwide,
providing professional advisement and case management around these
phenomena wherever they are taking place, and aiding communal
leadership in their efforts to establish standards of safety,
transparency and integrity in their own communities.  Examples
of consulting services we offer include:


Problem-solving through specific
	cases within the community 
	


Conflict management and mediation 
	


Abuser/victim clarification and
	reconciliation, including victim safety planning


Safety assessment and planning for
	communal institutions, including schools, religious facilities,
	camps, and places of employment 
	


Formulation of policy, procedure and protocol for use in
	communal settings 
	


Support
the launch of the JIBH:  mental health clinic, community education
and outreach source, think-tank, and consultancy firm, able to
deliver strategic solutions in therapy, in community education and in
workplace safety. 



Our Clinical DirectorTani Burton is the Clinical Director of the JIBH. A licensed social worker in Israel, He holds a masters degree in social work from Yeshiva University's Wuzweiler School of Social Work, as well as a Clinical Diplomate in Logotherapy from the Viktor Frankl Institue. Tani has worked in agency, educational, and private practice settings, and gained a sub-specialty in sexual offender treatment as a co-facilitator of forensic therapy groups and as a psychotherapist. Tani is responsible for the concept of the JIBH as well as the maintenance of its vision, human resources and staff hiring, community and professional outreach, and most importantly providing clinical services.

Our Campaign Goal
Our goal is to open the doors of the JIBH by the end of March 2015. The initial $50,000 will enable us to retain the legal services needed to obtain non-profit status in the United States and Israel, create and distribute promotional materials, launch a marketing and social media campaign, obtain necessary licenses, hire part-time therapeutic team members as needed and to procure and furnish an appropriate office space in a discreet location.

story:
Millions of amputees around the world live in poverty and have no access to prosthetics, which hinders their ability to function in society and take care of themselves and their families. We want to change that and bring hope to hurting families by providing affordable prosthetics and ongoing care.

The average cost of a standard prosthetic leg is between $3,000-$6,000 and takes several days and special machinery to construct. Phillip Johnson CPO, a prosthetist and the founder of Hope to Walk, saw the need to create a quality, affordable prosthetic that could be built simply with accessible materials. He created a prototype leg that we are now introducing to amputees in Honduras. Our first amputee patient, Carlos, has been wearing our prototype leg for the last six months and is doing well. It only cost $100 to make.

Using donations to pay for the leg units ensures anyone can receive a leg regardless of income. We will not be charging patients money, but instead will ask that they serve in their community once receiving a leg.   This will empower patients to be active and productive in giving back to their community.

Who we are: Hope to Walk is a non-profit humanitarian group devoted to providing prosthetics and ongoing prosthetic care for amputees who live in poverty.  You can learn more at our website: www.hopetowalk.org

What we are doing: We are funding a series of trips with the purpose of creating a model of amputee care that we can duplicate in undeveloped areas throughout the world where there is a great need for affordable prosthetics.

TRIPS

Honduras, May 2015


Our goals for the May Honduras trip:

• Test and refine various configurations of the prosthetic leg with the help of 6-10 amputee patients in Honduras who are eager to try them.

• Follow up with three amputees who have already been seen by Phil (HTW Founder) and fitted with prosthetics on earlier trips.

• Meet with the staff of a local clinic who have been instrumental in helping us develop our process and help oversee patients that have received a leg from Hope to Walk.

• Research materials in Honduras and surrounding countries to see what is available to use for building the leg, so that we can reduce the amount of materials shipped from the U.S.

• Train new team members to fit legs on amputee patients.

• Film a short documentary to help share the story about Hope To Walk, with the help of Silent Images.  Be looking for it on our website in July.

Future trips to Honduras are planned for August and October of 2015. The goal is to go every eight weeks and continue to test and refine the prosthetic leg and care for the ongoing needs of current and additional amputee patients.

THE FUTURE

Eventually, we will develop a kit comprised of all the components needed to make a prosthetic leg, and a training program, so that we can partner with other humanitarian groups and indigenous people and can begin forming Hope To Walk clinics around the world.

Your generous gift is greatly appreciated and we look forward to sharing the incredible stories of how Hope To Walk, through your assistance, is changing lives around the world.

story:
Hello folks,

My name is Andrei Klejman, i am the youngest son of Michael Klejman and this is my story.

My father has always been a passionate cyclist, every since his first bike in Poland as a young teen.  Since then it has always stuck, and to this very day at 70 years old he continues to maintain a healthy active lifestyle and love of cycling.  So much so that it has influenced both his sons cycling passions.

Recently though Michael had a incident where his bike was damaged beyond repair, and it has thus demoralized him and he isn't inclined to buying a new bike.  A simple decision which we feel is misguided. 

So here lies the mission.  A mission to re kindle the love of cycling which dates back around 60 years, a mission to empower a man who thinks his time has come and gone, a mission to make him feel young again.

Michael Klejman bike fund, the power of love.

story:
"The true essence of yoga is what you do from your heart, not what you do with your body." ~ Dana A. Smith, Author YES! Yoga Has Curves


Yoga is about healing and self love. YES! Yoga Has Curves Volume 1 helped to show the world that yoga comes in ALL beautiful shapes and sizes. The book inspired many Beautiful Curvy Yoginis to explore the art of yoga and in many cases deepen their practice.

YES! Yoga Has Curves Volume 2 features the healing stories of over 50 Beautiful Curvy Yoginis. YES! Yoga Has Curves the DVD will walk yoginis of all sizes, ages and abilities through the foundational practices of yoga.

We want this project to reach and inspire the masses. There's lots to be done in order to get both projects out. We hope to raise $15,000 to get the book and DVD completed and distributed to the masses! Donations will go towards finalizing the book, DVD production, marketing, printing and other costs associated with self-publishing.

With your support we will be able to spread the message that yoga is for EVERYbody! We believe that everyone can benefit from practicing yoga and know that the book and DVD will inspire practitioners of all sizes to explore yoga.

If you are unable to contribute financially we ask that you send your support by spreading the word to your family, friends, social networks or by thinking of us the next time you spend a quiet moment of reflection.

Thank you for your support!

story:
SC United is the new Men's College Gymnastics Team in Southern California, founded on June 13, 2014,  and is a 501 (c) 3 under the Southern California Men's Collegiate Gymnastics Association. SC United had an amazing first year with a National All Around Champion, a Bronze Medalist and two All Americans at the USAG Collegiate National Championships. In order to provide continued support and opportunities for our gymnasts we need your help! The team is now 13 men strong and growing. Approximately 92% of all funds raised will directly benefit the gymnast.  Your donations will be used towards:

  • Travel and accommodations to and from competition
  • Travel to and from training facilities
  • Competition uniforms and accessories
  • Competition fees
  • Equipment
  • Insurance 
  • Medical attention and athletic trainers
  • Training aids
  • Coaching fees
  • Setting up an endowment fund
  • Providing opportunities similar to any other Varsity Team

Please visit our website for detailed information about the team and the structure of the program.  www.southerncaliforniaunited.com.

story:
"Better Than Beats?

We believe that we have created the World’s greatest sounding in-ear headphones.

A bold claim, I agree, but let me try to convince you that it's not the fantasy of a madman...

From: Adam Blair
Founder, PUMP & OMG Audio

Dear Indiegogo-ers :-),

For the last year I've become somewhat obsessed with creating the perfect in-ear headphones.

When I say "perfect" I mean in terms of sound quality rather than in terms of adding some kind of revolutionary technology, a gimmicky dual-purpose application, or anything like that.

I just wanted the perfect sound and I used Beats as the benchmark.

I know that some people don't really like the Beats sound that much due to the "muddy" bass (search YouTube if you don't believe me!), but most LOVE it, (including me!), so we aimed at the seemingly impossible task of producing an earphone that appeals to BOTH of these sets of connoisseurs:

People that love the bass heavy Beats, and people that prefer a more "true frequency response"...

...Essentially, MUSIC LOVERS!

WHAT'S WRONG WITH BEATS?

Good question.

Really, not a lot. We just think we've taken the listening experience and build quality one step further.

At first I have to admit that my expectations in producing something that sounded better weren't that high. I have to be honest and tell you that headphones were only one of SEVERAL projects I planned to undertake in 2014.

At the start of 2014 I printed out some goals for the year ahead – which included business goals as well as personal goals — such as “be happy and relaxed most of the time” : -)

In the business goals section it said “Bring at least 5 new products to market”.

And we DID.

And then … I launched PUMP Audio.

My plan was to continue with more products and brands. I had investigated a quadrocopter product, a tablet computer, TVs… the list went on.

But I sort of fell in love with PUMP, and the results were twofold:

1- I decided to make sure that my other businesses could run properly with me giving less time to them (turns out they seem to run better, I think because I’ve empowered the people running them to do what *they think is right*, rather than having to ask me all the time);

2- I realised how *lucky* I was to be able to attempt a task such as taking on the big audio brands, and that business was not just about how much money you make!

I’d instinctively realised the second point when I first started out back in 2004, but somehow had forgotten it in recent years.

Money is important, yes, because it allows you to do things (such as start PUMP Audio), and it also allows you to improve people’s lives, including your customers (by offering better products and services), your families, and your own.

But money is really not the end goal in itself in my opinion. It’s more about having purpose, passion and doing things that you can be proud of.

Anyway, that was the big lesson I learned this year…

I've been very honest with you here about how I came to create the PUMP and OMG earphones.

It's not exactly a fairy story...

I first did it as just one of many products that I planned to bring to market.

But as I said, I sort of fell in love with them - I think because of the quality of the product. I know that sounds a bit over the top, but I really mean it.

I hope that by reading up on my blog posts you'll see the passion I've got for these earphones.

I never really thought we could create something that was MARKET LEADING (in terms of sound quality) when we started, but somehow we did.

And from that moment on, I decided to ditch every other new project I was doing and focus all my attention (and available funds) on PUMP and OMG.

I could have told you about how it's always been my dream to do it etc., but that would be stretching the truth somewhat!

I did try to start a record label in 2007 but that's another story...

If you'd told me 18 months ago that I would create and become obsessed with our own audio brand that aimed to BEAT the likes of Beats, BOSE and Sennheiser, I would have probably said "don't be ridiculous, how could we possibly do that?"!

Isn't it amazing how much things can change in a year?

Anyhow, I've given you a little background on how PUMP and OMG came in to existence. Now here is what you are probably more interested in...

Peoples reactions at the Christmas
Ideal Home Exhibition London
(November 2014)...


What's the difference between
PUMP and OMG?

The two brands are aimed at different market segments, but the earphones themselves are close to identical.

The physical design, construction, materials used and build quality are exactly the same.

PUMP has a slightly newer driver design which means that it can operate just outside the frequencies that a normal human ear can hear.

Some people say that they can hear this difference, but most (including me!) can not.

Both sound incredible.The only other difference is the box, which is a bit more high end with PUMP and costs us more to make.

To summarise, if I were you, I would go for the colour(s) that you like best!

The headphones themselves:

Here are the specs.

Frequency Range:

 - PUMP: 16 hz – 24000 hz

 - OMG: 20 hz - 20000 hz

Sensitivity:

 - PUMP: 102 dB (+/- 3dB)

 - OMG: 93 dB (+/- 3dB)

Impedance: 18 ohms

Complete Passive Noise Isolation

Specially tuned earbuds for small or regular/large ear canals

Specially Custom Tuned Drivers

Weight: <15g

3.5mm Gold Connector Jack

In Line Microphone

Water Resistant

Aluminium Casing (not plastic like Beats etc)

5 Year PUMP Full Replacement Warranty

The specs in and of themselves can't really articulate the quality of the sound and in particular the bass.

To do that, the only way I can really think of is for you to hear them for yourself. 

You can watch the response in the videos, but for all you know those people might be paid actors, or we might have just posted the minority of people who thought PUMP and OMG were better, giving a skewed impression.

In fact, the OVERWHELMING MAJORITY preferred PUMP and OMG to the other brands tested (Beats, SMS Audio, Sennheiser, BOSE, Marley), but of course I can't PROVE that here. It does require you to believe me unfortunately!

The only way to really prove what I am saying is for you to HEAR them for yourself.

That's why we've decided to offer Indiegogo Backers the following guarantee:

GUARANTEE

I know that this is a bit unusual for an Indiegogo project, but I would like to propose the following:

If you back us, and at any time within 6 months of the date you receive your headphones they don't live up to your expectations, we will refund your backing amount in full.

All you have to do is email or call us and we will honour this guarantee.

I know that a lot of headphones make bold claims vaguely alluding to the fact that they have amazing sound quality, but then when you listen to them it's hard to distinguish much of a difference. With PUMP and OMG I am categorically stating that you will immediately be able to hear that they sound significantly better than what you are currently using.

A bold claim, and that is why we are offering such a guarantee!

I'm expecting a very small take up on the guarantee, but it's there to give you confidence that what I am saying about the PUMP and OMG sound quality is true.

You can also read the customer reviews we've received so far for PUMP here and OMG here (they are all 100% genuine) and the Artist Endorsements for PUMP so far here (we haven't yet started approaching artists to review OMG, but will soon!).

Where We're At In
The Creation Process

We're already in production and have the finished articles ready to ship in the quantities shown in each reward level. We have physical possession of the first production at our HQ.

We've sold around 1000 units already and have received reviews from both users and -- in the case of PUMP -- artists and industry experts.

Indiegogo Backer Discount!

PUMP is usually sold at £99 plus shipping (or your local currencies equivalent).

OMG is usually sold at £79 plus shipping (or your local currencies equivalent).

That means that Indiegogo Backers are getting a 66.35% discount on PUMP and a 62.63% discount on OMG (or more if you order more than one of either).

And now for the Perks...


Stretch Goal #1 - PUMP Carry Case
(If we reach £10,000)!

From feedback from initial users, we found that many wanted carry case or pouch to carry their PUMPs/OMGs in. We've been working on it, with a view to including it in our next generation box design.

However, I've decided to bring it forward and offer a free PUMP carry case to all Backers (whether you've ordered PUMP or OMG).

Hopefully we'll make this stretch goal and then I'll have to think of some more to add!

As you've probably worked out, we are trying to really get the PUMP and OMG brands out there so that they start to go 'viral' and I really feel that Indiegogo is the natural way to achieve that.

I'll be *eternally grateful* to you if you would be prepared to help us achieve this internationally (while receiving a pretty awesome set of headphones in return!).

Thanks so much for your support, and I can't wait to hear your response to the PUMP & OMG headphones. They will change your enjoyment of the music you love forever. That is my promise.

Yours truly,

Adam Blair
Founder, PUMP and OMG Audio

P.S. Here's some recent twitter reviews:

You can see many more Artist and User comments at pump-audio.com :-)

Risks and Challenges

As with all Indiegogo projects there are risks, and these are the steps we take to mitigate against them:

1-

Loss of or damage to the shipment en route to us:

We usually use DHL for inbound shipments from the factory to us. This means that all shipments are fully insured. If we did lose a shipment for reasons I don't want to even mention for fear of tempting fate, it would be insured. We would have to re-manufacture (adding around a month to delivery time) but it would not affect your order.

2-

Loss or damage of your headphones en route from our warehouse to you:

We will replace any lost shipments. We will either take insurance, or insure ourselves for this eventuality. In the case of the latter (self insurance) then we will ship orders on separate days to mitigate against any unlikely issues such as a delivery truck crashing etc.

3-

We go out of business or don't deliver on our promises:

The company that owns PUMP and OMG is Speedcam Systems Ltd, which is a registered company in the United Kingdom. Company reg number 07751910. It was incorporated in August 2011 and is 100% owned by me (Adam Blair). It has been profitable every year since 2011. Speedcam Systems Ltd has no bad debt whatsoever. Neither Speedcam Systems or myself are planning to go anywhere any time soon!

4-

Our factory goes out of business:

I think this is extremely unlikely but if it did occur then we would either find a new factory or refund all orders.

5-

I can't think of any other risks but if you have questions please don't hesitate to ask. If the reply is slow then the reason is that I will be answering all emails myself so if we are deluged with questions it might take a while to get through them all! I'll post the most common questions up on Indiegogo as we go along.
